intro: Anacampseros subpyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean stonecress, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
